cpd.whatIs: Open Creator Rails is a production-ready, on-chain access and monetization runtime system that makes time-limited access rights to game resources deterministically manageable and verifiable for creators and developers.
whatIsNot: Not an experimentation or prototyping framework
Not a general identity or authentication product
Not a payment gateway or financial product
Not a creator marketplace or SaaS offering
cpd.neverImplicit: The decision of which states, data structures, and processes are irreversibly recorded on-chain must never be made implicitly.

cpd.whatIs: The Canton Network MCP Server is a paid Canton application that provides developers with programmatic access to Canton-specific blockchain functionality via the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and bills usage through x402-based payment headers.
whatIsNot: Not a free internal enablement tool
Not an SDK replacement for direct Canton integration
Not a generic MCP backend without economic semantics
Not an experimental prototype without billing logic
Not a product with implicit or blanket usage rights
cpd.neverImplicit: The decision of which MCP operations are paid and how their billing units are defined must never be made implicitly.

cpd.whatIs: The Canton x402 Payment Facilitator is a payment and billing capability that processes x402-compliant payment headers and provides reliable, replay-safe processing for paid tool/API usage.
whatIsNot: Not a product legitimized by OCR or MCP
Not a place for feature experiments
Not an implicit standard for all products
cpd.neverImplicit: The decision of which payment and replay semantics are guaranteed (and which are not) must never be made implicitly.

ccd.whatIs: DCAP is a conceptual framework for describing, discovering, and combining capabilities in agentic systems.
ccd.neverImplicit: The decision to treat DCAP as a product, standard, or mandatory layer must never be made implicitly.
relationshipRules: Products must not be defined by DCAP
DCAP may be influenced by product realities
DCAP must not replace product decisions
